title.narrative: LADE Mainstream a rights-based “Electoral Platform” as an instrument for social change 2016

description.narrative: This one-year project will contribute to Diakonia's Human Rights theme as it aims at enhancing the commitment of youth to community work and to increasing the level of their engagement in the public affairs. The project will contribute to mainstreaming rights-based “Electoral Platform” as an instrument for social change by creating a framework for sustainable and long-term engagement between LADE and youth. This framework involves two components: education and engagement. The educational aspect of the project will aim to broaden the human rights knowledge of the youth, particularly LADE volunteers in the regions, who have demonstrated leadership in their communities and commitment to learning and community work, throughout their engagement with LADE. Activities and description: 1. Socio-economic politics: A series of 4 discussions/lectures about the impact of policy making on people’s rights. The discussions will cover the history and the process that the human rights system went through with a focus on mechanisms that citizens can use for accountability, including election and electoral platforms. (Topics: Human rights system, covenants and protocols, influencing policy making through advocacy) 2. Community town hall meetings – local brainstorming sessions about local priorities, organized by LADE groups with the participation of civil society activists to facilitate the topics of discussion [suggested topics: local municipal budget/practical methods for sorting at source/ 3. “All Inclusive” – In flash mob style, local activities conceived and implemented by LADE groups that promote the idea of equality and accessibility in the local community; LADE groups will demonstrate through the placement of sample mechanisms how PWDs can have better access to physical spaces. They will also represent the work of female leaders in business, science and politics. This can be followed up with an invitation for said leaders to speak about their experience. [in cooperation and consultation with LPHU, RDFL and other women’s rights organizations]. 4. “Platforming” – after the town hall meetings, LADE groups will synthesize the ideas that were discussed and share a draft synthesis with the participants. Based on the participants’ feedback a final document will be developed for final endorsement. started
This project mainly contributes to results within Fulfilment of human rights commitments. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
